title: How to Have a Pirate Party (for Kids or Adults)

steps.headline: Make a pirate ship for the party by going to a local appliance store and getting a refrigerator box.
Make a Cave:
Food:
Goodie Bags: These will look like mini treasure chests.
steps.description: Need one paper lunch sack per child. Cut off top 2 inches (5.1 cm). Use black marker to give bag a wood design. Outline edges of bag. Make one line 2 inches (5.1 cm) from top (side to side) and keyhole. Fill with goodies and fold and tape. Spray paint paper bags gold. Have the kids or kids at heart (adults) decorate them with markers, sequins and stickers. make sure they put their name on the bag

steps.headline: Dress-up items:

text:
Make a pirate ship for the party by going to a local appliance store and getting a refrigerator box. Put the box on it's side and cut one side off. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/39/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Then cut the sides into a ship shape. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use the flaps from the top of the box to make a pointed bow, and draw planks on the side to make look like wood. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a helm by cutting the wheel shape out of cardboard (two pieces glued together to make it sturdy) and bolting that to another piece of cardboard which is bent in half so it stands up. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Use pvc pipes (very cheap at the hardware store) stuck into flower pots filled with rocks to be the masts and make sails out of poster boards with a jolly roger drawn on them. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-1Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a Cave: use several large cardboard boxes taped together with an entrance, dead end and exit. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut a few holes in the top for light and fill the boxes with balloons. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e9/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Hide pirate garb inside (hooks or other). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Net for tablecloth. Food: Serve hotdogs with pirate sails attached. Popcorn, goldfish, Swedish fish and gummy worms make good "fish bait. "{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2a/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cake and ice cream. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Ice cream cone cupcakes decorated like pirates. Sheet cake, frost with chocolate frosting. Use frosting tube or other to make a skull and crossbones on front. Put a frosting eye patch and bandana on the skull. Edge the cake with a design. Use fish on sides. Colorful small candies as jewels around. Could also find rectangular snack cakes, cut tops to hinge like a chest and fill with candies. Set these at corners of cake. Rectangular cake decorated with wavy blue butter cream frosting. Make an island out of an upside down muffin cake, decorate green to make an island. Decorate with Playmobile pirate toys. Red punch for "crocodile blood punch. "{"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Scary fish made out of a watermelon. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/88/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut small v's at one end of the watermelon to resemble a mouth with teeth and scoop out the insides into little melon balls. Then fill the fishes mouth back up with the melon balls, grapes, etc. Blue jello with gummy octopuses suspended in the middle to look like the ocean. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet5.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet5.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c3/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet5.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-4Bullet5.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Goodie Bags: These will look like mini treasure chests. Need one paper lunch sack per child. Cut off top 2 inches (5.1 cm). Use black marker to give bag a wood design. Outline edges of bag. Make one line 2 inches (5.1 cm) from top (side to side) and keyhole. Fill with goodies and fold and tape. Spray paint paper bags gold. Have the kids or kids at heart (adults) decorate them with markers, sequins and stickers. make sure they put their name on the bag Dress-up items: Vest: Need-bolt of black felt, pinking shears, Wonder Under or other iron web, white cotton fabric remnant, white fabric paint. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4c/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make a simple pattern so all you need to do is sew to side seams. Cut out with the pinking shears. Draw a skull and crossbones on the white fabric to make a patch with the Wonder Under on the vest. Outline with the fabric paint to make it more secure. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d4/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Telescopes: Need-paper towel tubes. Spray paint black, cover one end with plastic wrap and tape on with wide, colored masking tape (hardware store). {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Pirate Hats: Need-slick, vinyl like fabric. Again a two piece design, sewn together on the sides. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet4.jpg/v4-460px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet4.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet4.jpg/v4-760px-Have-a-Pirate-Party-%28for-Kids-or-Adults%29-Step-6Bullet4.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Enjoy
